  Hallo,
  Eric Dantan Rzewnicki (and others) wrote:

  >>> So the lac2008-subfolder should keep
  >>> Christoph Haag's cool design as a kind of complete package with a
  >>> common look and feel.
  >>
  >> sure. - I even think we should take this look'n'feel over to the
  >> lac.linuxaudio.org front-page (which will point to /2007/ /2008/ ) -

  Hehe, thanks for the compliments. The design by Christoph however is
  meant to be the design for LAC2008 only, where we basically had
  *everything* wrapped into it, like posters, shirts, flyers, programme,
  proceedings - even the nametags! And the logo is a play on the coat of
  arms of Cologne, so it wouldn't make much sense for Parma. ;)

  > I've long thought it would be good to have the ZKM and TU sites moved to
  > linuxaudio.org. But on the other hand, I think part of the reason they
  > remain at the hosting intitutions is to continue to provide some
  > exposure for them and recognistion of their contribution. The local
  > teams probably need to at least give their OK for moving the conference
  > sites under linuxaudio.org.

  That's one thing we intended to get started this year: Although it
  would have been possible to make a *.khm.de site for LAC2008 we
  actually wanted to move the LAC over to linuxaudio.org as much as
  possible. So we tried to hide all references to any *.khm.de site like
  lac2008.khm.de (except of course the main www.khm.de site) from the
  public's view, including the streaming site. *.linuxaudio.org should
  be the home of LAC from now on IMO.

  >> On one hand it would be cool to stick to this wordpress (and not move it
  >> to /2008/) but who knows what the next LAC organizers will like?  - I'll
  >> think about a rewrite rule, to make the transition go smooth.
  >
  > I would like it very much if we could establish some continuity of
  > organizational teams and infrastructure from year to year. Each year
  > will of course have local team organizers who will put their own touch
  > and style on the conference. But, if we have a maet-cal@linuxaudio.org
  > list,

  Actually I think, we should start this list immediately now to archive
  this discussion, too.

  > irc channel and perhaps wiki that persist from year to year, I
  > think the work of the local team will benefit greatly from the
  > participation of past years' organizers and the work of the streamteam
  > will improve through closer colaboration with the orga-team.
  >
  > To some extent this already happens, but mostly behind the scenes in
  > German and not in a public forum. I suppose to some degree certain
  > things wrt sponsorship and submission selection need to be kept private.
  > But as a stream-team member for 4 of LACs 6 years, I would like to at
  > least have access to the logistical discussions as I feel we can do a
  > better job and be of more use to the orga-team if we have more
  > information and some input into the process.

  Actually in the end, the lac-orga list we had stayed almost unused:
  Most discussions happend between Martin and myself face to face or by
  phone, often with Christoph Haag on the line as well for design issues
  or Laura Oldenbourg for the proceedings. Dealing with things face to
  face was also necessary because it's so much faster than writing
  mails and the nearer LAC came, the faster we had to deal with things.

  Many organisational issues are rather uninspiring anyways, like
  checking out local manufacturers for T-Shirts. ;)

  We never felt the need for an IRC channel as a tool to prepare the
  LAC. A private LAC wiki however would have been useful for certain
  things (like the list of people to thank. We forgot some ...).

  I think, a project management system (maybe Trac) would be even
  better. I did use SVN a lot during LAC-preparation for press texts,
  funding requests etc. These things require finely grained access
  control like: everyone should read press releases, only Martin and myself
  should access the financial side etc. so Trac may be nice, but PMWiki
  etc. would not.

  OpenConf was almost perfect for handling the paper review process. I
  lacks a database field for who is presenting the paper at the
  conference, if more than one author is listed. It has a field for the
  main author, but that wasn't the presenter in several cases. Other
  than that it was very useful. Installation should be fresh each year
  however.

  Ciao
  --
   Frank Barknecht                                     _ ______footils.org__

  > Most discussions happend between Martin and myself face to face or by
  > phone, often with Christoph Haag on the line as well for design issues
  > or Laura Oldenbourg for the proceedings. Dealing with things face to

  > mails and the nearer LAC came, the faster we had to deal with things.

  I understand that most of the details are face-to-face type things, but
  there is at least some advance planning that could benefit from
  geo-dispersal. Also, just having a location where regular updates and
  status for the concerned parties to stay informed would be a good thing.
  Might also be useful to have some way to organize voluneers.

  > Many organisational issues are rather uninspiring anyways, like
  > checking out local manufacturers for T-Shirts. ;)
  >
  > We never felt the need for an IRC channel as a tool to prepare the
  > LAC. A private LAC wiki however would have been useful for certain
  > things (like the list of people to thank. We forgot some ...).

  > should access the financial side etc. so Trac may be nice, but PMWiki
  > etc. would not.

  votes++ for project management system.

  > OpenConf was almost perfect for handling the paper review process. I
  > lacks a database field for who is presenting the paper at the
  > conference, if more than one author is listed. It has a field for the
  > main author, but that wasn't the presenter in several cases. Other
  > than that it was very useful. Installation should be fresh each year
  > however.

  OpenConf is presumably open source, so perhaps we can send a patch
  upstream? At any rate, I would very much like to have the conf mgt
  system decided and persistent year-to-year so we can get the streaming
  meta-data and file naming scripts pulling from it.

  Anyway, shall we hold off further discussion until we have an archived
  list?

  -Eric

  hi everyone!


  i just copied the ambisonic recordings from lac2008 over to
  lac2008.khm.de:/var/local/ogv/ambi-recordings.

  the directory doesn't show in the apache, because it's 700, and it needs
  to stay that way until somebody has made sure what the licenses are.

  i had to link the recordings of the thursday concert into /home/cmml,
  because the raid was full.


  i'm pulling the data home over the next 1-2 days.


  best,

  Lieber Christoph,

  bei Dir soweit alles fit?  Gut zurück gekommen, wieder erholt?

  Dank Dir nochmal ganz herzlich für alle Deine Mühen!

  Hat die KHM inzwischen gezahlt?  Ich habe nämlich auch von Jörn schon
  gegenteiliges gehört, wäre interessant zu wissen, ob das ein
  "globales" Problem ist.

  Ich hätte eine Bitte, und Frank und ich noch eine zweite:

  1) Könntest Du mir/uns noch die PDF-Versionen von den ganzen
  LAC-Dokumenten zu Archiv-Zwecken schicken?  Die Flyer und die
  Konzertprogramme?  Habe letztens gemerkt, daß ich die gar nicht habe.

  2) Frank und ich würden gern noch eine Dank-Aktion an die ganzen
  unermüdlichen Helfer und Unterstützer der LAC starten.  Dazu hatten
  wir uns überlegt, im dreiteiligen Flyer-Schema eine Dank-Karte
  aufzusetzen.  Meinst Du, Du könntest nochmal in die Sklavenrolle
  schlüpfen und eine solche zusammenschieben?

  Wir hatten gedacht: A4 einseitig zum Drittelfalten.  Wenn das A4-Blatt
  auseinandergefaltet vor Dir liegt, dann das rechte Drittel mit der
  üblichen LAC-Titelei und dem Krautsalat.  Das mittlere Drittel
  ebenfalls mit Krautsalat, und vielleicht sollte da noch irgendwo das
  KHM-Logo hin, oder war das schon auf der ersten Seite?  Auf das linke
  Drittel dann nur prominent mittig das LAC-Adler-Logo.

  Wir würden den Flyer dann so drittelfalten, daß die Titelseite vorne
  ist (ACH!) und der Krautsalat des mitteren Drittels auf die Rückseite
  kommt.  Die Seite mit LAC-Adlerlogo wird so eingeschlagen, daß man es
  zu sehen bekommt, wenn man die Titelseite aufschlägt.  Wenn man das
  Logo auch noch aufklappt (Triptychon), dann kommt nicht der
  gekreuzigte Jesus zum Vorschein, sondern ein exklusiver
  handschriftlicher Dank von Frank und mir.  (JAHAAA!  Die Mühe machen
  wir uns!)  Ich verwende übrigens schwarze Pelikan Fount India Tusche
  (!) für Federhalter, also mit Pigmenten drin.  Frank plays PAISTE
  cymbals.

  Das ganze auf 120g Zanders Bankpost mit Wasserzeichen und Nadelstich
  im Umschlag.  Und bei dem Layout bräuchten wir nur einseitig zu
  drucken.

  Wie findest Du Idee?  Wäre das für Dich möglich?  Als Bezahlung können
  wir leider nur eine solche Karte anbieten: mit handschriftlichem Dank.

  Die herzlichsten Grüße nach Augsburg aus Graz!

  Martin

  -_-_-

  Lieber Christoph,

  habe ich heute gemacht, und scheint zu klappen!  Man muß beim Falten
  schon genau sein, sonst steht rechts was über oder der Einschlag mit
  dem Logo paßt nicht rein -- aber Genauigkeit ist ja schließlich unsere
  Stärke (siehe Eintrag: "Nationalität", aber das hatten wir schon).

  Danke Dir ganz herzlich!

  War heute auch schon Papier schöpfen, muß jetzt noch trocknen.  Ganz
  schöner Aufwand, die Wasserzeichen da reinzumalen.  Und man sieht ja
  nix, solange alles naß ist.

  Viele Grüße und bis bald!

  Martin

  hallo martin,

  mir gehts ganz gut. wir haben hier die letzten 5 monate animationen
  gemacht, für pro7 (großes kino: "sex report 2008").

  das ist jetzt erstmal rum und so wieder zeit für ruhm und ehre zu arbeiten.
  habe schon vermutet, dass auch 2009 die lac nicht plötzlich im geld
  schwimmt,   trotz aller professionalisierungstendenzen in köln.
  bin gespannt, ob die italiener gute gestaltung zu schätzen wissen.

  und bei dir, was macht die professur?

  die plakate habe ich hochgeladen, ein paar bilder verschoben und jeweils
  die links angepasst.

  plakate sind insgesamt 69mb)
